results.title: Profile of a quartet
results.creator_credit: Peter Newington, BBC-TV and Humphrey Burton
results.brief_description: A glimpse of the work which goes into a production of good chamber music. Introduces the members of the Quartet both at home with their families and at rehearsal together where much discussion takes place and several pieces of chamber music are played. Illustrates the focussing of the four men’s lives to produce this close teamwork.

results.title: Profile of a problem drinker
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Stanley Jackson
results.brief_description: The causes of drinking and the effects of liquor on the life of a young architect, analysing some of the reasons which may lead to a person to problem drinking. Shows the importance of recognising the early symptoms of alcoholism and dramatises the remedial action necessary for effective cure..

results.title: Professor Hoffnug's Yaya's memoirs
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Hoffnung”.
On his birthday Professor Ya Ya amusingly recalss come musical performances by members of his family including Uncle Alfredo in Naples, Cousin Augustra in Madrid, Uncle Giovan at La Scala, and finally Ya YA Junior , a opo singer on television. One of a series based on Gerard Hoffnung’s cartoon drawings.

results.title: Professor Finger builds a bridge
results.creator_credit: Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Anroste Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
Dodo and the bird come to the rescue of the Professor when his new inventions of a plastic bridge over a ravine cannot take the stress. The remains of the bridge become a ferry instead.

results.title: Professor Erikson. Part 2
results.creator_credit: KUHT Film Productions and James L. Brown
results.brief_description: An investigation of some theories of psychoanalysis, and personality growth in relation to the work of Dr Erik Erikson, of Harvard University, a pioneer in the field of child analysis and research. Part 2 deals with the Libido theory, Ego-identity, Identity crisis, Positive and negative identity, existentialism, cross-cultural research, fixation and the value of psycho-therapy. The ensuing discussion touches upon Erikson’s relationship to the theories of Freud; additions and modifications to subsequent theories; the crisis of adolescence; and the problems facing psycho-analysis today.

results.title: Professor Erikson. Part 1
results.creator_credit: KUHT Film Productions and James L. Brown
results.brief_description: An investigation of some theories of psychoanalysis, and personality growth. The film takes the form of an interview between Dr Erik Erikson, of Harvard University, a pioneer in the field of child analysis and research and Dr Richard Evans, of the University of Houston. They discuss Erikson’s theory of the eight stages of psycho development. Part 1 and 2 produced under a grant awarded by the national Science Foundation, USA.

results.title: Profession of arms
results.creator_credit: Artransa Park Studios and Alex Ezard
results.brief_description: Life as a cadet at Duntroon - history and background. Shows National War Museum at Canberra and Duntroon - Australias only military college - established in 1911, as part of a defence plan recommended by Field Marshall Lord Kitchener. Royal Military College is an intensive four year course in academic and military training affiliated with the University of NSW.

results.creator_credit: Tina Viljoen, Michael Bryans and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “War”.

results.title: Products of Broken Hill
results.brief_description: Describes the mineral products of Broken Hill, the methods of processing the ore, and the refining of lead at Port Pirie and zinc at Risdon, Tasmania.
